ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I seriously improved my writing abilities, as well as my ability to read and analyze essays of various types.
I learned so much about writing and reading, especially across a lot of different literature categories that I never read or discussed before.
Canonical essays in english literature
I learned how to write personal narratives. I loved taking this course. It allowed me to see writing in a new view. I really appreciated this course.
writing skills, learning to revise writing and be more concise
creative nonfiction writing
I greatly improved my writing skills and learned how to write in my voice. I also learned how to write essays quickly and efficiently, while still producing my best work.
My writing and critical reading skills significantly improved.

I developed a better understanding of how to closely read and write different types of personal essays, all while getting a chance to use this writing opportunity as a way to get in touch with myself.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think the course was strong in the large amounts of sharing and interaction among classmates via discussion. I really loved the seminar aspect and learned a lot from my peers. I think the course could have been improved by having even more space for comments and feedback given on the work (essays) we submitted. Sometimes I felt like there wasn't enough advice or criticism given.
I think I would have liked to do some more interaction with my peers writing. I think there were some times class was a bit slow because we were only interacting with work of those we didn't know.

strengths: instructor feedback provided helpful insight into essays, readings were extremely engaging
weaknesses: class discussions felt dominated by the same people sometimes,
4 essays is good. turnaround is tight but the weeks off are nice

The strength of this course was that it truly improved my writing with how much we had to write. The feedback on all the drafts were also super clear. In addition the discussions were always lively and intriguing. One improvement that could be made is in the discussions. Sometimes, it felt like some points weren't discussed enough as there was no time for response. The professor would call on all students and then let them take turns speaking in order. This made it so that sometimes, one person jumped to another topic, not allowing the previous topic to be delved further into. This could be improved by taking some time to just ask, "Does anyone want to respond to this point?"
I thought this course was very strong - only wish we had more class time!

This was one of the best classes I've ever takenthe engagement is unparalleled, both from Morgan and peers. I loved the pieces we got to read (so well chosen), and Morgan guides us through them well. Morgan also gives amazing, in-depth feedback for essays that really allowed me to challenge myself and improve them before the final draft. Getting the chance to read the work of my peers has also been such an honor: everyone had such a distinct voice, and I'm so glad I got a window into everyone's world all while learning from them. Peer review sessions and class discussions were also helpful and active. I have no complaints about this class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely! ENGL 120 has definitely made me a better writer and some of the essays we read have sort of changed my life.
Yes, I would definitely recommend English 120. It is a vital class toward learning how to properly write and analyze texts.
Yes. I think this class was therapeutic in a way. It allowed me to look at my own personal experiences through a new lens. I would recommend this class to every Yale student!
Yes! Every Yale student should take English 120 before they graduate
I would 100% recommend this course to another student, regardless of what major. This course significantly improved my reading and writing skills.
yes, especially for writing credit / non-english majors to practice writing

I would recommend this course to another student since it truly helps you become a better writer and the discussions and readings are always interesting and insightful. They taught me to think about the bigger picture and think more abstractly, especially as a STEM major. In addition, the types of essays in this course are different from ones I've done before. I am used to doing academic writing and writing in the same format and template every single time; however, with this course, I was able to write about my personal life and discover my own voice as an author.
Absolutely - this is one of the best classes I've taken at Yale.

100%! I cannot recommend this class enough. You can get so much out of it, and explore parts of yourself that you haven't had a chance to uncover. Though sometimes the writing turnaround can be fast, the workload is never unreasonable. You get a chance to engage with and learn from peers in such a lively, inspiring way. This class is an absolute joy and I cannot recommend it enough for students of all majors.
